column4: I'm not a locale expert on ubuntu, but hopefully it can resolve your problem
: do i need a reboot after reconfiguring the new locales?
cause i got an error, it couldn't find my locale file, again...
try opening up synaptic and search for locale
it is there, i installed and reinstalled it
dpkg-reconfigure locales rebuild locales on your system, do you haven't seen it listed during reconfigure?
it is listed during the reconfigure. is "rebuild locales" another command?
that's the way, but it didn't solve your problem.. sorry if I cannot help more on this
lets try a reboot. otherwise it is back to zero with this machine.
: back. now i got all the menus in my language but the keyboard is still english, which is the exact opposite of what i wanted
try editing /etc/X11/xorg.conf and set the right XkbLayout
